newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times business - July 31.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times business - July 31.

text.p: The New York Times reported the following business stories Thursday:
* Congressional and White House budget negotiators retreated from a plan that would have pushed capital gains taxes higher on some sales.
* J.P. Morgan & Co said it would invest $900 million for 45 percent of American Century Cos.
* Japan ordered the Nomura Securities Co and Dai-Ichi Kangyo Bank to suspend part of their operations for the rest of this year as punishment for making payments and loans to a racketeer.
* Fujitsu plans to pay about $850 million to buy the 58 percent of Amdahl that it does not already own.
* MCI reported a 6.7 percent drop in earnings.
* Several fund companies said that July would probably rank as the year's second best month, after January.
* Stock prices soared as analysts pointed to robust corporate profits.
* Gasoline futures prices jumped to six month highs.
* Kia of South Korea proposed to shed $6.4 billion in assets.
* Sales of new single family homes rose 6.1 percent in June.
* Northwest Airlines said it would buyback the 19 percent stake held by KLM Royal Dutch Airlines.
